skills.name: Order integers with the same number of digits
Use inequality notation to order integers with the same number of digits

explanations.A: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.B: I think you have confused the direction of the inequality symbols. Remember the wider/open part of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.C: 472 is greater than 427, which would be written as 472 > 472. 250 is less than 360, which would be written as 250 < 360.
explanations.D: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.

explanations.A: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.B: 351 is greater than 315, so 351 > 315. 140 is less than 410, so 140 < 410.
explanations.C: I think you have confused the direction of the inequality symbols. Remember the wider/open part of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.
explanations.D: One of these statements is not true. Remember the open side of the inequality symbol will face the larger number.

explanations.A: You might have looked at the end of the number and said 9 is greater than 1, but we need to compare the beginning of each number. Is 500 less than 800 or greater?
explanations.B: We compare the first digits first. Five hundred is less than eight hundred, so 599 is less than 801.
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first...
explanations.D: One number is greater than the other... Look at the first digits. Is 500 less than 800 or greater?

explanations.A: You might have looked at the end of the number and said 9 is greater than 2, but we need to compare the beginning of each number. Is 500 less than 700 or greater?
explanations.B: We compare the first digits first. Five hundred is less than seven hundred, so 589 is less than 702.
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first...
explanations.D: One number is greater than the other... Look at the first digits. Is 500 less than 700 or greater?

explanations.A: The first digits are the same, so we look at the second digit. 90 is greater than 80, so 398 is greater than 389.
explanations.B: I think you might have looked at the end digit and said 8 is less than 9. We start comparing at the beginning of the number... The first digits are both 3, so compare the second digits.
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first, then the second...
explanations.D: One number is greater than the other... Look at the first digits, then the second. Is 90 greater than 80 or less?

explanations.A: The first digits are the same, so we look at the second digit. 70 is greater than 60, so 576 is greater than 567.
explanations.B: I think you might have looked at the end digit and said 6 is less than 7. We start comparing at the beginning of the number... The first digits are both 5, so compare the second digits.
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first, then the second...
explanations.D: One number is greater than the other... Look at the first digits, then the second. Is 70 greater than 60 or less?

explanations.A: The first digits are the same, so we look at the second digit. 0 is less than 6, so 406 is less than 460.
explanations.B: I think you might have mixed up the symbols... This symbol means greater than. Is 06 greater than 60?
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first, then the second...
explanations.D: The symbols mean less than and greater than. Is 406 less than 460 (answer A) or greater than 460 (answer B)?

explanations.A: I think you might have mixed up the symbols... This symbol means less than. Is a number in the 800s less than a number in the 600s?
explanations.B: The first number is in the 800s and the second is in the 600s, so 876 is greater than 678.
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first, then the second...
explanations.D: The symbols mean less than and greater than. Is 876 less than 678 (answer A) or greater than 678 (answer B)?

explanations.A: I think you might have mixed up the symbols... This symbol means less than. Is 74 less than 47?
explanations.B: The first digits are the same, so we look at the second digit. 7 is greater than 4, so 874 is greater than 847.
explanations.C: These two numbers are different. Which one is bigger? Compare the first digits first, then the second...
explanations.D: The symbols mean less than and greater than. Is 874 less than 847 (answer A) or greater than 847 (answer B)?

explanations.A: The first digits are the same, so we look at the second digit. 8 is less than 9, so 289 is less than 298.
explanations.B: I think you might have mixed up the symbols... This symbol means greater than. Is 89 greater than 98?
